title: GEODE-5206: Add an 'ignoreFailure' flag to CliFunctionResult
body:
- The intention of this is to avoid needing to pass 'skip-if-exists' or
  'if-not-exists' flags to any command function. The function should set this
  flag if it determines that the construct it is dealing with either already
  exists or does not exist depending on the action. The calling command will
  then be able to use this information to display and set status appropriately.

title: GEODE-5187: clients can miss events when servers recycled
body:
* When draining events from the giiQueue, the msg field of HAEventWrapper may be null.
  Update the HAEventWrapper to point to the message in the HAContainer vs. calling
  putEventInHARegion with the original HAContainer message (a ClientUpdateMessageImpl).
  This is necessary as the ClientUpdateMessageImpl does not have the eventId (this is not
  serialized/deserialized in toData/fromData).  The HAEventWrapper is required on the
  remote side to reconstruct the event.

* Updated log messages to include the HARegionQueue.regionName

* Added corresponding IntegrationTest

body:

contains Scala library. This has been fixed in version 2.19.0.

Updating the version of fast-classpath-scanner allows deploying JARs
that contain the Scala library (i.e., fat JARs).

…erver connection during handshake

Absense of the holder, which had just been inserted into the
idsToHolders collection, means that another thread has resolved the
holder into an actual DataSerializer class and has removed the holder
and its supported classes.

title: GEODE-5041: Adding post processing to the new protocol
body:
Invoking the user's post processor before returning results from the
experimental protobuf protocol.

This PR is split up into two commits - one commit that adds the post processing and one commit that renames everything from Authoriz* -> Secure* because we are now doing post processing as well as authorization. I recommend looking at the post processing commit separately, since the rename touched a lot of files.

title: GEODE-5172: refactor txApplyPut to reuse RegionMapPut
body:
AbstractRegionMapPut has been introduced and has the common code used for both a non-tx put (RegionMapPut) and a tx put (RegionMapCommitPut).
RegionMapCommitPut is used by txApplyPut. I thought this name was better than RegionMapTransactionPut because this is not a put done during a transaction but what needs to be done at commit time for a put that was done during a transaction. Another possible name would be RegionMapTransactionApplyPut but I liked CommitPut better because it is more concise.

The unit tests provide good coverage for both AbstractRegionMapPut and RegionMapCommitPut.
The old unit test for RegionMapPut still exists and has been improved but still does not cover all the code in RegionMapPut class. I will file a ticket to improve that test. At one time I thought that would be part of this ticket but I think this ticket should focus on txApplyPut.

@dhemery

title: GEODE-5164: refactor txApplyPut
body:
The goal of this refactor was to combine three large blocks of code into one method. These three blocks were 90% duplicates of each other.
The new method in the resulting code is: txApplyPutRegionEntry.
I new class was introduced, TxApplyPutContext, which is expected to go away in a future refactoring when txApplyPut is changed to use a subclass of RegionMapPut.
The control flow in txApplyPut has also been changed to follow the pattern of RegionMapPut which will aid that future refactoring.

@dhemery

title: GEODE-2668: Better handling of configuration updates
body:
In cases where destroying GWRs may fail on some or all servers, control
configuration updating based on state of --ifExists option.
--ifExists == true --> update config
--ifExists == false --> do not update config

Added tests for edge cases with failures on servers.
